notes: GA Dept of Game and Fish established 1911 financed by license fees. Self-sustaining from inception. 148 wardens by 1913. 104 WMAs exist but licensing is statewide; either-sex days and bag limits set by county. Big Game License required as add-on for deer/turkey/bear.

notes: MD 1872 law required $20 license for sink-box waterfowl hunting on Susquehanna Flats—earliest known US hunting license of any kind. General county hunting licenses ~1910 (earliest known specimen: 1910 Baltimore County NR license). Statewide licenses ~1916-18. 23 counties + Baltimore City = 24 jurisdictions. Deer managed by Region A (western) and Region B (all other).

Reciprocal 10-day rates with GA/SC/TN/VA. Comprehensive license adds big game + waterfowl to base hunting license.
